Job Title: Senior Hydrogeologist

Location: Albuquerque, NM

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Senior HydrogeologistJohn Shomaker & Associates, Inc. (JSAI) has an opening for a Senior Hydrogeologist that will be involved with managing JSAI projects and clients, performing analysis of environmental and water resource related data, preparing reports, and marketing of services. JSAI projects include water planning, environmental, surface water investigations, groundwater flow models, well site construction and management services, data collection, pumping tests, sampling, and the like. The primary duties include assisting Principals with projects for a wide range of clients in New Mexico and Texas. The ideal candidate should have groundwater flow modeling experience and possess a professional demeanor so they can effectively interact with Managing Principals, Staff, and clients.ResponsibilitiesManage individual projects and required staff from start to finishPerform hydrogeologic analysis of data using analytical methods, numerical models, and other methods, and develop technically sound conclusions and recommendationsField work and data collection related to hydrogeologic evaluations and water well projectsManage and perform surface water and groundwater data collection projectsAssist with field work related to environmental projectsGeologic mapping and locating hydrologic featuresDevelopment and maintenance of databasesGeneration of technical reports including conclusions and recommendationsTechnical presentations to clientsSeek out new clients, develop proposals and cost estimates, develop and maintain good relations with clientsResponsible for project budgetsTechnical work with office computers, network system, and softwareOther duties as required or as assigned by Managing PrincipalsQualificationsB.S in Geology, Hydrogeology, or water resource related field with 10 yrs experience and PG License, or M.S. in Geology, Hydrogeology, or water resource related field with 9 yrs experience and PG license or certification from professional organization(s)· U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident status and Valid Driver’s License· Train and manage staff in a way that is encouraging and facilitates learning· Ability to work with all JSAI personnel to accomplish project goals· Basic understanding of construction industry and ability to use hand tools· Able to develop and maintain client base, and complete projects on time and on budget· Working knowledge of Microsoft Office software (excel and WORD), MODFLOW, etc· Perform out-of-town work (as personal schedule allows)· Must be able to safely lift 50 lbs· Health and Safety training (HAZWOPER, MSHA, etc)Strong ability to multitaskSalary range $85,000 to $120,000. Full-time position with eligibility for benefits and profit sharing.

Experience Level (if available): None
